body.p:
darktable consists of several views or modes. There are five available views as described in this section. You can switch between views by clicking the view name at the top of the right panel the active view is highlighted or by using one of the key accelerators:
L
switches to lighttable
D
switches to darkroom
T
switches to camera tethering
M
switches to map
S
switches to slideshow
P
switches to print

section.title: Lighttable
section.p: The lighttable view is where images and film rolls are managed. It's also where you rate images, add tags and colorlabels, and export images among other actions (see Lighttable).

section.title: Darkroom
section.p: In the darkroom view you develop a single image using the available modules (see Darkroom).

section.title: Tethering
section.p: This view is for shooting with the camera connected to the computer and remotely capturing images that will be downloaded and shown on computer screen (see Tethering).

section.title: Map
section.p: This view shows images with geo-tag data on a map and allows manually geo-tagging new images (see Map).

section.title: Slideshow
section.p: This view shows images as a slideshow, processing them on-the-fly (see Slideshow).

section.title: Print
section.p: This view allows you to send images to your printer (see Print).
